chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren J Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Return of JOC. Insufficient address.  (remailed to address on CC)
From Sentencing Hearing on November 30, 2015 before Honorable Steven P Anderson, prepared by court reporter Kathy Malsom

Defendant Darren J Bishop in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Darren J Bishop in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF13.  Parties make argument on sentencing.  DE addresses the court.  DE has 364 days credit.  

15CF12
Ct 1-8 years total,  4 in/4 out. Concurrent with Ct 2, 15CF13 and Federal Case 15-CR-16-BBC and Minnesota case 73-CR-14-10353 that DE is currently serving.
Ct 2-2 years total, 1 in/1 out.  Concurrent with Ct 1, 15CF13 and Federal Case 15-CR-16-BBC and Minnesota case 73-CR-14-10353 that DE is currently serving.

15CF13
Ct 1-8 years total, 4 in/4out.  Concurrent with Ct 2 and Ct 3, 15CF12 and Federal Case 15-CR-16-BBC and Minnesota case 73-CR-14-10353 that DE is currently serving.

Ct 2-4 years total, 2 in/2 out. Concurrent with Ct 1 and Ct 3, 15CF12 and Federal Case 15-CR-16-BBC and Minnesota case 73-CR-14-10353 that DE is currently serving.

Ct 3-2 years total, 1 in/1 out.  Concurrent with Ct 1 and Ct 2, 15CF12 and Federal Case 15-CR-16-BBC and Minnesota case 73-CR-14-10353 that DE is currently serving.

DE will be eligible for CIP and SAP in both cases.  DE to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge on all counts.  

Restitution of $4942.03 in 15CF12 Joint/Several with co-defendant Justin Maple, Rusk Case 14CF113

Restitution of $4068.11 in 15CF13 Joint/Several with co-defendants:
Jonathan W Hamilton-Rusk Case #15CF08
Joseph Johnson-Rusk Case #15CF7
Dan Chacon-Rusk Case #15CF23

Repayment of court ordered financial obligations, including restitution

No contact with any victims
DE to maintain absolute sobriety
DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR at this time.  (filed in 15CF12)
